title: (2011) Alcest - Le Secret (EP Re-release) [FLAC] {100.XY}
description:
Alcest - Le Secret (Re-release)


image Wikipedia:
Alcest is a French shoegazing band/musical project (formerly a black metal band) from Bagnols-sur-CÃƒÂ¨ze, France, founded and led by Neige (StÃƒÂ©phane Paut). It began in 2000 as a black metal solo project by Neige, soon a trio, but following the release of their first demo in 2001, band members Aegnor and Argoth left the band, leaving Neige as the sole member.
This marked a change in style, as Alcest's subsequent releases have more often been described as shoegazing mixing numerous rock and metal influences, including black metal and post-metal. In 2009 the ex-Peste Noire's drummer Winterhalter (now in Les Discrets) joined Alcest's studio line-up, after eight years with Neige as the sole full time member. Since its creation, Alcest has released three studio albums.


image Review:
Because we are talking about a shoegaze/black metal hybrid here and this record is absolutely gorgeous, I could pontificate ad-nauseum with wistful metaphors to describe the borderline transcendent power of this music. I could proclaim loudly how Ã¢â‚¬Å“Le SecretÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ and Ã¢â‚¬Å“ElevationÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ have these slow building epic soundscapes that remind you of strolling through a tranquil forest in autumn astride a mighty unicorn or some ridiculously corny sh*t like that. I could regale you all with sweeping prose about the majestic power and beauty on display here, how itÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s like wondering into some Goddamn cave with dripping water made even more awesome by piercing sunlight or some overpoweringly pretentious sh*t of the like.
Instead letÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s just get straight to the damn point, because I donÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t really know that much about blast beats and tremolo picking and am not going to waste anybodyÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s time trying to describe the black metal influences vs shogaze in any kind of focused, linear way. This EP has 4 tracks and two songs, with two versions of each, an original from 2006 and a re-recorded version from this year. The re-recorded ones are infinitely better in their production and are thus vastly superior overall, although the originals are strong in their own right, maybe even better if you enjoy sh*ttier production. Ã¢â‚¬Å“Le SecretÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ is mostly a shoegaze track with angelic vocals and a driving sense of melody, and itÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s a damn good song. Ã¢â‚¬Å“ElevationÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ is probably one of the greatest songs IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve ever heard. ItÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s about 14 minutes long, and itÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s astoundingly gorgeous. I canÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t tell you if this is better than their last full-length although Ã¢â‚¬Å“ElevationÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ is absolutely better than anything on that album. Even if you hate black metal, shoegaze, the French, or think youÃ¢â‚¬â„¢re too manly to listen to something that makes you want to careen through a glistening dewy meadow wearing sparkly stuff or some reprehensibly gay sh*t like that, you should probably at least give this a try.
Review by BigHans (4.5/5)
